ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Developing playwriting skills (structure, dialogue, character, etc.)

I went from having never really written a complete play before to having a portfolio of three solid first drafts of complete one-act plays. Through the act of writing these, supplemented by the helpful insights of Professor Jacobs-Jenkins in class, I developed an actual process for my playwriting, and I feel like I've been equipped with the skills to continue sustainably generating my own work going forward.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course was very clearly laid out at the beginning of the semester: writing three one-act plays and providing feedback for our classmates' work. I think I would have loved some more consistent reading, just because it's helpful to be reading a lot of plays while you're trying to write your own. We all write feedback for our classmates, but I think it might have also been useful to received written feedback from Prof. Jacobs-Jenkins.
Hes brilliant. I just wish he cared about teaching more. Feedback was limited.

I really appreciated the way this course was set up. My only change would be more discussion of the elements of a play and the technical aspects of playwriting towards the beginning of the semester, as I found the lectures on that super helpful and would've loved to go more in depth with it!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! Prof. Jacobs-Jenkins is great and it's a really helpful space to generate material and get some feedback on it.
Maybe. Its very hands-off and feedback is limited. The Professor is brilliant but not especially helpful

If you're seriously interested in writing, absolutely. I think any writer could benefit from taking this course, since a class truly dedicated to being a writers' workshop can be rare at Yale, but I would definitely recommend taking another playwriting course first. Professor is fantastic and you'll come out of the course with a plethora of practical knowledge and skills.
